dataStorage.title: Default Data Storage
dataStorage.description: Select the default storage location for storing request and response data
dataStorage.label: Data Storage

storage.title: Storage Settings
storage.description: Configure how the system handles and stores response data

storeChunks.label: Store Response Chunks
storeChunks.description: When enabled, the system will store response data chunks in the database for subsequent analysis and processing

policy.title: Storage Policy
policy.description: Configure storage policies and data cleanup settings to manage data retention and storage efficiency

storeChunks.label: Store Response Chunks
storeChunks.description: When enabled, the system will store response data chunks in the database for subsequent analysis and processing. This enables detailed request tracing and debugging but increases storage usage.

storeRequestBody.label: Store Request Body
storeRequestBody.description: If disabled, original request body will not be persisted. Enable this for complete request auditing and debugging. Disabling reduces storage usage and improves privacy.

storeResponseBody.label: Store Response Body
storeResponseBody.description: If disabled, final response body will not be persisted. Enable this for complete response analysis and debugging. Disabling significantly reduces storage requirements.

policy.cleanupDescription: Automatically remove old data after specified days to manage storage growth and comply with data retention policies.

general.title: General Settings
general.description: Configure basic system information and branding settings

brandName.label: Brand Name
brandName.description: Set the system brand name that will be displayed in the interface

brandLogo.label: Brand Logo
brandLogo.description: Upload a square PNG or JPEG logo (max 2MB). The logo will be displayed in the system interface.
brandLogo.invalidFormat: Please upload a PNG or JPEG image file.
brandLogo.fileTooLarge: File size must be less than 2MB.
brandLogo.notSquare: Please upload a square image (width equals height).

other.title: Other Settings
other.description: More system configuration options will be added here

retry.title: Retry Policy
retry.description: Configure automatic retry behavior for failed requests to improve system reliability

enabled.label: Enable Retry
enabled.description: When enabled, the system will automatically retry failed requests. This helps improve reliability when experiencing temporary network issues or service unavailability.

loadBalancerStrategy.label: Load Balancer Strategy
loadBalancerStrategy.description: Choose how channels are ordered when routing requests.

documentation.adaptive: Based on comprehensive consideration of weight, success rate, round-robin, and trace strategies to select appropriate channels for requests. Intelligently balances multiple factors to optimize channel selection.
documentation.weighted: Each request follows channel weight order from high to low until one succeeds. Higher weight channels are prioritized sequentially for all requests.

maxChannelRetries.label: Max Channel Retries
maxChannelRetries.description: Maximum number of times to retry across different channels (0-10). When a channel fails, the system will try other available channels up to this limit. Higher values increase reliability but may increase latency.

maxSingleChannelRetries.label: Max Single Channel Retries
maxSingleChannelRetries.description: Maximum number of times to retry on the same channel (0-5). Controls how many times to retry the same channel before switching to a different channel. Useful for temporary glitches.

retryDelayMs.label: Retry Delay (ms)
retryDelayMs.description: Delay between retry attempts in milliseconds (100-10000ms). Shorter delays provide faster recovery but may overwhelm struggling services. Longer delays give services more time to recover.

autoDisableChannel.label: Auto Disable Channel
autoDisableChannel.description: Automatically disable a channel when it exceeds the maximum number of retries for specific HTTP status codes

statuses.label: Status Codes
statuses.empty: No status codes configured. Add a status code to auto-disable channels.

onboarding.title: System Onboarding
onboarding.description: Welcome to AxonHub! Let's set up your system with a quick tour.

welcome.title: Welcome to AxonHub!
welcome.description: Let's configure your system settings to get started. This tour will guide you through setting up your brand, retry policies, and data storage.

brandName.title: Set Your Brand Name
brandName.description: Enter your organization or project name. This will be displayed throughout the interface.

brandLogo.title: Add Your Logo
brandLogo.description: Upload your logo to customize the look and feel of AxonHub for your organization.

retryPolicy.title: Configure Retry Policy
retryPolicy.description: Set up automatic retry behavior for failed requests to improve reliability.

retryEnabled.title: Enable/Disable Retry
retryEnabled.description: Toggle retry functionality on or off. When enabled, failed requests will be automatically retried.

retryMaxRetries.title: Maximum Retry Attempts
retryMaxRetries.description: Set the maximum number of retry attempts for failed requests. Higher values increase reliability but may delay failure notifications.

retrySingleChannel.title: Single Channel Retries
retrySingleChannel.description: Configure how many times to retry on the same channel before switching. Useful for temporary glitches.

retryDelay.title: Retry Delay
retryDelay.description: Set the delay between retry attempts. Shorter delays provide faster recovery but may overwhelm struggling services.

dataStorage.title: Data Storage Settings
dataStorage.description: Configure how your data is stored and managed. This is important for performance and compliance.

storageEnabled.title: Data Storage Options
storageEnabled.description: Choose what types of data to store. You can enable storage for chunks, request bodies, and response bodies.

storageChunks.title: Store Chunks
storageChunks.description: Enable chunk storage for streaming responses. This allows you to view partial responses and analyze streaming behavior.

storageRequestBody.title: Store Request Bodies
storageRequestBody.description: Save request payloads for debugging and analysis. This increases storage usage but provides valuable insights.

storageResponseBody.title: Store Response Bodies
storageResponseBody.description: Save response payloads for auditing and analysis. This significantly increases storage usage but provides complete data.

dataStorageSelection.title: Data Storage Backend
dataStorageSelection.description: Choose the storage backend for the request and response data. Different backends offer different performance and cost characteristics. Default is database, you can also configure other storage backends.

storageCleanup.title: Data Cleanup Policies
storageCleanup.description: Set up automatic cleanup rules to manage storage space and comply with data retention policies.

storageCleanupRequests.title: Request Data Cleanup
storageCleanupRequests.description: Configure automatic cleanup for request data to manage storage space and maintain system performance.

storageCleanupUsageLogs.title: Usage Logs Cleanup
storageCleanupUsageLogs.description: Set up cleanup policies for usage logs to comply with data retention requirements and optimize storage.

complete.title: Setup Complete!
complete.description: Great! Your system is now configured. You can always modify these settings later in the System Settings page.

about.title: About AxonHub
about.description: System version information and update status

updateCheck.title: Check for Updates
updateCheck.description: Check if a newer version is available
updateCheck.upToDate: You are running the latest version

backup.title: Backup
backup.description: Create a backup of your system data including channels and models

restore.title: Restore
restore.description: Restore your system data from a backup file
restore.warning: Warning: Restoring from a backup will overwrite existing data. This action cannot be undone.
